txt.en: Ausma is continuing to explore, and will need your help.
'Meetings? With whom?'
You should eavesdrop and see what can be learned.
'This way. Keep an eye out for hobgoblins.'
'Call her in. You can ask her yourself, Margzasht!'
'I was listening in, as you told me to, and I learned that Gorgar is having private, and secret, meetings in the mountain peaks-'
'If she wishes to help us win this war, I see no reason to send her away!'
'What was that? Keep your comments to yourself.'
Talk to Scoutmaster Ausma
Follow Scout-master Ausma
Talk to Scout-master Ausma
'And behold, another way into the fort.'
Listen to the conversation
You have found another way into Shakhajât
'Keep your eyes and ears open. We don't want to suddenly find ourselves surrounded by hobgoblins.'
'Ah! You are most generous, Warlord! I will not fail you!'
'Why? What do they talk about at these meetings?'
'Now get out of my sight before I change my mind about letting you live.'
'You wished to see me, Warlord?'
'I have to say, sneaking around the back instead of charging in the front goes against my Longbeard instincts!'
'You had better not, Zúrgurat. Now, go!'
'HAHA! You see? You are afraid of her, because she is strong, fierce, and cunning. These are all traits I value in our warriors.'
'If there's one thing the Stout-axes know, it's that you sometimes have to go places you aren't supposed to if you want to survive.'
TBD Stonejaws Quest Instance 1
'Indeed. I would like an update on your little project.'
'I don't know! AAH!'
Instance: The Inner Circle
'Hmm. Keep an eye on them, and send for me when your gift is ready.'
'Heh. I'm not sure you could, even if you wanted to.'
'Oh... we are quite high up. Are we sure this will support our weight?'
'As you wish.'
'I'm not sure of anything, but I believe we'll find what we need if we go this way.'
'Oh, and one more thing before I depart...'
'Yes, Warlord.'
'If you are wasting my time AGAIN, Zúrgurat...'
'Wh- ? How dare you speak that way to me! ARGH!'
'WHAT?'
'Urbhármokh is one of our last strongholds. If we lose, the future for our kind is bleak.'
'If you fail me, I will gut you myself and throw your innards to the ukhrâsh!'
'This way may be unguarded.'
'Wow. She really let them have it!'
'Dushtalbúk has a spy close to Gorgar? Interesting.'
'Warlord Dushtalbúk! I have urgent news!'
'Aye, the hobgoblins know that, and that's why we're NOT going that way.'
'Let's get out of here before we're seen. We can talk about what we just learned back at camp.'
'Well, we're inside now, but who knows where? Stay close to me, and keep to the shadows. Let's see if we can't find the warlord.'
'No, no, I swear it, Warlord! It's about Gorgar!'
'That must be Dushtalbúk! Over here!'

'Good, we managed to get this far unseen. We're on the west side of the pit now. I noticed there are quite a few catwalks and scaffolding on the exterior of Shakhajât. I have a hunch we'll be able to use them to find another way inside the fort. Are you ready to move in?'
Scout-master Ausma intends to find a way deep into Shakhajât in order to learn more about Warlord Dushtalbúk and his advisors.
'We should listen in on their meeting. Keep yourselves hidden, or we'll be discovered.'
'With the Dragon! With... Hrímil!'
'Only one guard, and he's asleep! Hah!'
'I am still wary that they have not shared their true motives, but I don't believe they mean to betray us.'
'Just try not to look down.'
'Well, I believe. The Angmarim prove themselves useful to us. She is in Shakhajât if you wish to-'
'Akúlog, how is Loknashra's work proceeding?'
'You will find out where these meetings take place, and what they discuss in secret.'
'I know you speak behind my back because you are too cowardly to confront me. Let me make something perfectly clear.'
'Warlord, why are we allowing these females to fight in Gundabad? Surely their place is in the North, raising our young?'
'Ah, um... no, I don't think that will be necessary, Warlord....'
Enter Shakhajât
'I will send for her.'
<rgb=#FF0000>Do not allow the hobgoblins to see you!</rgb>
'Bring him in! That maggot better have something worth saying this time.'
'Loknashra? Who is this?'
'Good. Do you trust them?'
'Keep that in mind while you continue your petty squabbles with Gorgar.'
'I came here myself to make sure this war is won, because none of you can be trusted to win it!'
Ausma is pleased with your progress so far.
'I'm listening.'
'The Angmarim have kept their word. I am learning their magic, and soon we will have a gift to present to the Frost-horde.'
You should follow Ausma.
